result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**Reviewed by Judge Melvin on 10-17-2022: Extension approved. Reset review hearing with parties.**
Clerk notified Dr. Jenna Niess via email of extension on 10-17-2022.
Order for Examination under Section 971.16, Wisconsin Statutes (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect) for 2nd examination signed by Judge Melvin on 10-3-2022.

Case called at 10:16 a.m.
Attorney Patrick Campbell in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Ricardo Tapia in court for Glen H Roessler. 
Defendant Glen H Roessler in court, in custody.  
Court addresses the report filed by Dr. Westendorf which supported the NGI plea.
Defense accepts Dr. Westendorf's findings.
State requests that the court appoint a 2nd doctor from Behavorial Consultants to do an NGI evaluation.
Court will order a 2nd NGI evaluation under section 971.16, Wisconsin Statutes.
Defense requests that Cash Bail be modified.  State objects.
Court denies the motion.
Review hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Review hearing on August 24, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

Case called at 10:04 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Glen H Roessler in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia. 
Attorney Tapia enters a NGI plea.
Court orders defendant to be examinated under section 971.16, Wisconsin Statutes.
Attorney Tapia requests Dr. Melissa Westendorf if she is available.

Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Stipulatin for Return/Destruction of Original Exhibits

10:21 AM Defendant Glen H Roessler in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Ted Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  City of Waukesha, detective, Thomas Casey, sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Szczupakiewicz.  Exhibit #1 marked, offered and received.  Cross examination by Atty. Tapia.  Redirect.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Szczupakiewicz makes closing statements.  Atty. Tapia makes closing statements.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken; and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Victim C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives/tasers/explosives/grenades/pepper spray.

01:33 PM Defendant Glen H Roessler in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Katrina Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Griffis appears as friend of the court.  Defendant was not evaluated by the public defender's office.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
